- Clinton has an old, historic downtown. Both the Library and the Town Hall, have shingled roofs with colorful flower patterns. some old churches, and commercial blocks make the town a pleasant place to visit

- an historic lighthouse, built in 1850. it is constructed in the "imperial style", a style not seen anywhere else in Ontario.the lighthouse is open at as a museum, and one can climb to the top to take in the (not so great) view.

- Located in Goderich, the capital of Huron County, the Huron County Museum is surprisingly good for a local museum, and contains thousands of artifacts including antique farm machinery, regimental badges, and entire steam train, and Victorian bone china.
-located in Goderich, this octagonal building served as the town jail for many years, and was the sight of the last hanging in Canada. It is now a museum and a national historic sight.
- one of the best beaches in Ontario. unfortunately it is very crowded.

Great Canadian Theatre ~ Blyth Festival:  Founded in 1975, the Blyth Centre for the Arts and Blyth Festival serves as an arts centre for Huron County in southwestern Ontario and produces a summer season of all-Canadian plays. Visit www.blythfestival.com for current information.
